title: Interactive MOOC Design and Learner Retention Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Short intensive course for enhancing job competencies within organizations, requiring learning design centered on real-time interaction and formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can explain at least three effective interaction strategies in MOOC environments.
Learners perform at least two collaborative activities with peer learners using real-time online tools.
Learners monitor and reflect on their learning progress on a weekly basis through formative assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
